translation.title: The Exterior as Impermanent in the Three Times

next.name: The Exterior as Suffering in the Three Times

previous.name: The Interior as Not-Self in the Three Times

segments.en: 195–197. The Exterior as Impermanent in the Three Times

segments.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, aniccā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā aniccā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are impermanent …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights,…

suttaplex.translated_title: The Exterior as Impermanent in the Three Times
